intro: Bursera simaruba var. yucatanensis, commonly known as the Yucatan bursera, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to the Yucatán Peninsula. It belongs to the Burseraceae family, which includes frankincense and myrrh trees, and is characterized by its aromatic resinous sap. The plant has a dense, rounded crown with elliptical leaves that are glossy and dark green. Its flowers are small, yellowish-green, and appear in clusters, followed by small, round fruits that split open to release seeds. This species is well adapted to tropical climates and is often found in dry, limestone soils.
